sent: More Resources   Printable Cookies Policy   Data Policy   Terms   Facebook Ads Settings   Privacy Basics  Cookies &amp.

sent: other storage technologies Cookies are small pieces of text used to store information on web browsers.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies are used to store and receive identifiers and other information on computers, phones and other devices.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Other technologies, including data we store on your web browser or device, identifiers associated with your device, and other software, are used for similar purposes.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: In this policy, we refer to all of these technologies as “cookies.”   We use cookies if you have a Facebook account, use the Facebook Products, including our website and apps, or visit other websites and apps that use the Facebook Products (including the Like button or other Facebook Technologies).
point_text: We use cookies if you have a Facebook account, use the Facebook Products, including our website and apps, or visit other websites and apps that use the Facebook Products (including the Like button or other Facebook Technologies).

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies enable Facebook to offer the Facebook Products to you and to understand the information we receive about you, including information about your use of other websites and apps, whether or not you are registered or logged in.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: This policy explains how we use cookies and the choices you have.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Except as otherwise stated in this policy, the Data Policy will apply to our processing of the data that we collect via cookies.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Return to top Why do we use cookies?

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies help us provide, protect and improve the Facebook Products, such as by personalising content, tailoring and measuring ads, and providing a safer experience.
point_text:
Cookies help us provide, protect and improve the Facebook Products, such as by personalising content, tailoring and measuring ads, and providing a safer experience.
The cookies that we use include session cookies, which are deleted when you close your browser, and persistent cookies, which stay on your browser until they expire or you delete them.
While the cookies that we use may change from time to time as we improve and update the Facebook Products, we use them for the following purposes:

Source.Name: match_452.csv

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: While the cookies that we use may change from time to time as we improve and update the Facebook Products, we use them for the following purposes: Authentication We use cookies to verify your account and determine when you’re logged in so we can make it easier for you to access the Facebook Products and show you the appropriate experience and features.
point_text:
While the cookies that we use may change from time to time as we improve and update the Facebook Products, we use them for the following purposes:
        
Authentication We use cookies to verify your account and determine when you’re logged in so we can make it easier for you to access the Facebook Products and show you the appropriate experience and features.
point_title: Information is provided about how your personal data is used

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: We use cookies to keep you logged in as you navigate between Facebook Pages.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies also help us remember your browser so you do not have to keep logging in to Facebook and so you can more easily log in to Facebook via third-party apps and websites.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example, we use the ‘c_user’ and ‘xs’ cookies for this purpose, with a lifespan of 365 days.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Security, site and product integrity We use cookies to help us keep your account, data and the Facebook Products safe and secure.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: Cookies can help us identify and impose additional security measures when someone may be attempting to access a Facebook account without authorisation, for instance, by rapidly guessing different passwords.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies to store information that allows us to recover your account in the event that you forget your password or to require additional authentication if you tell us that your account has been hacked.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: This includes, for example, our ‘sb’ and ‘dbln’ cookies, which enable us to identify your browser securely.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies to combat activity that violates our policies or otherwise degrades our ability to provide the Facebook Products.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: Cookies help us fight spam and phishing attacks by enabling us to identify computers that are used to create large numbers of fake Facebook accounts.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies to detect computers infected with malware and to take steps to prevent them from causing further harm.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Our ‘csrf’ cookie, for example, helps us prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies also help us prevent underage people from registering for Facebook accounts.Advertising, recommendations, insights and measurement We use cookies to help us show ads and to make recommendations for businesses and other organisations to people who may be interested in the products, services or causes they promote.
point_text: We use cookies to help us show ads and to make recommendations for businesses and other organisations to people who may be interested in the products, services or causes they promote
point_title: Your personal data is used to employ targeted third-party advertising

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: Cookies allow us to help deliver ads to people who have previously visited a business’s website, purchased its products or used its apps and to recommend products and services based on that activity.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies also allow us to limit the number of times that you see an ad so you don’t see the same ad over and over again.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example, the ‘fr’ cookie is used to deliver, measure and improve the relevancy of ads, with a lifespan of 90 days.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies to help measure the performance of ad campaigns for businesses that use the Facebook Products.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: We use cookies to count the number of times that an ad is shown and to calculate the cost of those ads.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies to measure how often people do things such as make a purchase following an ad impression.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: The ‘_fbp’ cookie identifies browsers for the purposes of providing advertising and site analytics services and has a lifespan of 90 days. .

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies help us serve and measure ads across different browsers and devices used by the same person.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: We can use cookies to prevent you from seeing the same ad over and over again across the different devices that you use.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies also allow us to provide insights about the people who use the Facebook Products, as well as the people who interact with the ads, websites and apps of our advertisers and the businesses that use the Facebook Products.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: We use cookies to help businesses understand the kinds of people who like their Facebook Page or use their apps so they can provide more relevant content and develop features that are likely to be interesting to their customers.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies, like our ‘oo’ cookie, which has a lifespan of five years, to help you opt out of seeing ads from Facebook based on your activity on third-party websites.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Learn more about the information we receive, how we decide which ads to show you on and off the Facebook Products and the controls that are available to you.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Site features and services We use cookies to enable the functionality that helps us provide the Facebook Products.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: Cookies help us store preferences, know when you’ve seen or interacted with Facebook Products’ content and provide you with customised content and experiences.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For instance, cookies allow us to make suggestions to you and others, and to customise content on third-party sites that integrate our social plugins.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: If you are a page administrator, cookies allow you to switch between posting from your personal Facebook account and the Page.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We use cookies like the session-based ‘presence’ cookie to support your use of Messenger chat windows.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: We also use cookies to help provide you with content relevant to your locale.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: We store information in a cookie that is placed on your browser or device so that you will see the site in your preferred language.Performance We use cookies to provide you with the best experience possible.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: Cookies help us route traffic between servers and understand how quickly Facebook Products load for different people.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Cookies also help us record the ratio and dimensions of your screen and windows and know whether you’ve enabled high-contrast mode, so that we can render our sites and apps correctly.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example, we set the ‘dpr’ and ‘wd’ cookies, each with a lifespan of 7 days, to deliver an optimal experience for your device’s screen.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Analytics and research We use cookies to better understand how people use the Facebook Products so that we can improve them.
point_text: We use cookies to better understand how people use the Facebook Products so that we can improve them.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: For example: Cookies can help us understand how people use the Facebook service, analyse which parts of the Facebook Products people find most useful and engaging, and identify features that could be improved.Google Analytics We also set cookies from the Facebook.com domain that work with the Google Analytics service to help us understand how businesses use Facebook's developer sites.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: These cookies have names such as __utma, __utmb, __utmc, __utmz, __qca and _ga.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Third-party websites and apps Our business partners may also choose to share information with Facebook from cookies set in their own websites' domains, whether or not you have a Facebook account or are logged in.

Source.Name: match_452.csv
sent: Specifically, cookies named _fbc or _fbp may be set on the domain of the Facebook business partner whose site you're visiting.
point_text:
Our business partners may also choose to share information with Facebook from cookies set in their own websites' domains, whether or not you have a Facebook account or are logged in.
Specifically, cookies named _fbc or _fbp may be set on the domain of the Facebook business partner whose site you're visiting.
Unlike cookies that are set on Facebook's own domains, these cookies aren’t accessible by Facebook when you're on a site other than the one on which they were set, including when you are on one of our domains.
They serve the same purposes as cookies set in Facebook's own domain, which are to personalise content (including ads), measure ads, produce analytics and provide a safer experience, as set out in this Cookies Policy.
